intro: Calceolaria tripartita subsp. inaequalis, commonly known as the unequal calceolaria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its unique, spurred flowers that are typically orange or red in color. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking floral display. Calceolaria tripartita subsp. inaequalis prefers partial shade and is relatively easy to grow in temperate climates.
